meanings.definition: To dispose of by a raffle.
meanings.sent1: She raffled off her old bicycle at the school fair.
meanings.sent2: They raffled the gift basket to raise money for charity.
meanings.sent3: The teacher raffled her collection of stickers to reward the top student.
meanings.sent4: The magician raffled his tricks to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent5: The children eagerly awaited their turn as the teacher raffled the prizes.

meanings.sent1: He raffled for a chance to win the grand prize.
meanings.sent2: She raffled with excitement at the prospect of winning a trip.
meanings.sent3: The friends raffled together, hoping one of them would be lucky.
meanings.sent4: The crowd raffled in anticipation as the winning ticket was drawn.
meanings.sent5: Everyone raffled their tickets, eager to see if they were the lucky winner.
